content.description: Start in the back of the flaring chimney, and work your way to the top.
content.protection: some smallish gear is useful in the back of the chimney
content.location: Behind the left side of Canada Mayflower

climbs.name: Skull Orchard
climbs.fa: ???  Only on TR so far.... Needs to have remaining loose holds identified yet.

content.description: Skull Orchard climbs the steep slab left of the route "Birchy" up under the mild roof  then takes the roof via jugs along deep rails just left of the little upper corner of "Birchy" (keep from using anything to the right from roof line above).  The route shares the same finish as "Birchy" were the rock slabs out and a bolted anchor can be found.  The crux is for sure the steep moves to get the feet established above the roof line.
content.protection: 2 SS 3/8's inch by 2 by1/4 inch long bolts with SS hangers and SS lap-links for top anchor. Have not yet explored for trad gear options but there are options of varying larger sizes. TR only so far.  It's fragile Sandstone so trad gear options maybe supplemented with fix gear?
content.location: So far, this line can be considered the 4th (maybe 5th)? line to the right of "Canadian Mayflower".

content.description: A fun romp up a featured face, with a distinct crux move at the top.
content.location: The center of the wall of easy routes, right of the prominent slab.

content.description: Start on the overhanging jugs to the left of With Flare.  Climb up and enter the chimney, finishing straight up.
Start at the toe of the face.  Gain the steep slab and bargain your way up the center.
content.protection: There is a bolted anchor at the top, otherwise nada.
content.location: Up the middle of the striking, flat face.

content.description: Make your way up the easy face.  At the bulge near the top, find a way up near a crack to the right of Crunchy Lichen.
Head up to the right end of the overlap, pull through it, and continue to the top.
content.location: To the right of the prominent Canada Mayflower face, just right of the overhanging chimney.
